intro: Astragalus ishkamishensis, commonly known as the Ishkamish milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. Astragalus ishkamishensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
